headline: 1,400 Buildings Across City Are a Serious Safety Threat for Pedestrians
abstract: Landlords flout laws on building exteriors and ignore enforcement, including $31 million in fines, The Times found.
lead_paragraph: The warning from the New York City building inspector was blunt. The facade of the apartment building in the Bronx was crumbling and a corner was separating. The playground outside a day care center in the building had to close immediately.
